org.libav.util

Class Buffer<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.libav.util.Buffer<T>

  • public class Buffer<T>
extends Object
    Generic synchronized buffer of fixed size.
    Author:
    Ondrej Perutka

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected Object[] buffer 
      protected int count 
      protected int end 
      protected int front 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Buffer(int bufferCapacity)
      Create a new buffer with the given capacity.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clear()
      Drop all elements stored in the buffer.
      void dropPut(T elem)
      Put a new element into this buffer.
      T front()
      Get the least recently inserted element but do not remove it.
      T get()
      Get the least recently inserted element from this buffer.
      int getCapacity()
      Get buffer capacity.
      int getItemCount()
      Get number of objects inside this buffer.

      Put a new element into this buffer.

      Put a new element into this buffer.

      Get the least recently inserted element from this buffer.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Buffer

        public Buffer(int bufferCapacity)
        Create a new buffer with the given capacity.
        Parameters:
        bufferCapacity - a buffer capacity

    • Method Detail

      • getItemCount

        public int getItemCount()
        Get number of objects inside this buffer.
        Returns:
        number of objects inside this buffer

      • getCapacity

        public int getCapacity()
        Get buffer capacity.
        Returns:
        buffer capacity

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Drop all elements stored in the buffer.

      • shiftPut

        public void shiftPut(T elem)
        Put a new element into this buffer. Remove the least recently inserted element if the buffer is full.
        Parameters:
        elem - an element

      • dropPut

        public void dropPut(T elem)
        Put a new element into this buffer. Do nothing if the buffer is full.
        Parameters:
        elem - an element

      • waitPut

        public void waitPut(T elem)
             throws InterruptedException
        Put a new element into this buffer. Wait until there is a free space if the buffer is full.
        Parameters:
        elem - an element
        Throws:
        InterruptedException

      • put

        public void put(T elem)
        Put a new element into this buffer. Doubles the buffer capacity if there is no space to store the given element.
        Parameters:
        elem - an element

      • get

        public T get()
        Get the least recently inserted element from this buffer.
        Returns:
        the least recently inserted element or null if the buffer is empty

      • waitGet

        public T waitGet()
          throws InterruptedException
        Get the least recently inserted element from this buffer. This method waits until there is an element available if the buffer is empty.
        Returns:
        the least recently inserted element or null if the buffer is empty
        Throws:
        InterruptedException

      • front

        public T front()
        Get the least recently inserted element but do not remove it.
        Returns:
        the least recently inserted element or null if the buffer is empty
